listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This excellent family house believed to have been built in the 1930's and once owned by the church and lived in by the Bishop of Tonbridge. The property has been significantly extended and refurbished and the accommodation is light, spacious, flexible and arranged over two floors and points of particular note include:-An impressive entrance hall with roof lantern, tiled flooring, fitted cupboards and a cloakroom.- The sitting room to the front of the house has a large bay window and solid wood flooring.- The elegant drawing room also with a large bay window to the front has a marble surround gas coal effect fire with fitted shelving either side. This leads into a large study which has fitted cupboards and through to a cloakroom, door to the side of the house and a further study.- An Amdega conservatory has terracotta tiled flooring and double doors opening directly onto the terrace.- A bespoke fitted David Haugh kitchen/breakfast/living room is well fitted and equipped with wooden wall and base units with cupboards and drawers underneath, an island and larder units and long black granite work surfaces. There is ample space for a table and chairs and further living area if required, a set of double doors open onto the terrace.- The principal bedroom has a large square bay window with outlooks to the garden, fitted wardrobe cupboards and a feature fireplace with tiled surround. A well fitted en suite bathroom has a vanity unit, separate shower cubicle and bath.- There are five further bedrooms three of which have en suite facilities and a smaller bedroom has access to a balcony with views.SituationForest Road is a highly regarded location on the southern edge of Tunbridge Wells. The mainline station, the High Street and the famous Pantiles, are all within about 1 mile. In the town centre there are excellent shopping facilities, particularly at the Royal Victoria Place shopping centre where there are many major national stores. There are highly regarded schools in the town including grammar schools and a wide variety of recreational amenities including Dunorlan Park with its boating lake and Hawkenbury recreational grounds which is a short distance from the property with tennis courts, astro turf for hockey and football and a play park.OutsideTo the front, the house is extremely well screened and a gated entrance opens into a large courtyard driveway which provides parking for a number of vehicles and access to the garage. To the rear, a wide terrace adjoins the house offering a lovely spot in which to entertain and enjoy the outlook. The garden is mainly laid to lawn with a wide selection of mature plants, shrubs and trees with access to the front at either side and a children’s play area. Beyond the garden is a fenced swimming pool and small pool house. In all the garden extends to 0.38 acres.Additional InformationTrain Services: Tunbridge Wells station for trains to Charing Cross, London Bridge and Cannon Street about 50 minutes.Road Communications: The A21 is to the north of Tunbridge Wells for a direct route to the M25
listing.short_description: This excellent family house believed to have been built in the 1930's and once owned by the church and lived in by the Bishop of Tonbridge. The property has been significantly extended and refurbished and the accommodation is light, spacious, flexible and arranged over two floors
listing.displayable_address: Bishops Lodge, 129 Forest Road, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

listing.description: Stunning and individual, newly built detached home. This imposing, 5+ bedroom house built by Westoak Homes, is set in a popular road, within 1 mile of the mainline station and The Pantiles, with an electronic gated entrance, block-paved parking and an integral double garage. Finished to a high specification with stylish fitments, decorated in neutral tones with large windows allowing the house to be filled with natural light. The generously proportioned rooms make this exceptional home the perfect setting for entertaining or relaxing into family life. There is a spacious drawing room, study, well-appointed kitchen with space for a dining table and sofas and a separate dining room if you prefer something more formal. Each bedroom has either a bathroom or shower room, with the master bedroom having a dressing room as well. This property really has been well thought out for every day life, with additional fridge, freezer and oven in the utility room, a separate room on the first floor to act as a laundry room and the top floor having a room perfect for a home office or playroom. The rear garden enjoys the afternoon and evening sun, with a paved patio for summer barbecues and steps up to a level lawn. Ready for immediate occupation.
listing.short_description: Stunning and individual, newly built detached home. This imposing, 5+ bedroom house built by Westoak Homes, is set in a popular road, within 1 mile of the mainline station and The Pantiles, with an electronic gated entrance, block-paved parking and an integral double garage.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A superb detached family house originally dating from the 1930’s and subsequently significantly extended to provide substantial accommodation of over 3000 sq ft across two excellent floors. Presented beautifully throughout, points of particular note include:- An inviting reception hall with a fine staircase rising to the first floor, a feature circular window and limestone flooring with a door to an excellent triple aspect drawing room with square bay windows to both front and rear, a door opening to the garden and an ‘Art Deco’ open fireplace.- A beautifully fitted kitchen with an extensive range of wall and floor mounted units including a wide island, granite work surfaces and integrated appliances including 2 ovens, a dishwasher, a fridge/freezer, microwave and 2 aeg wine fridges. An adjacent utility room is fitted with units to match the kitchen with an integrated washing machine, tumble drier and fridge freezer.- The tiled floor from the kitchen continues through to a superb open plan dining/sitting room with a fantastic roof lantern and 3 sets of French doors, all fitted with bespoke plantation shutters, which open directly to the garden.- An impressive double aspect family room with a square bay window to the front and a feature circular window to the side which leads on to a small study fitted with extensive book shelving.- On the first floor, a spacious landing with a stunning casement window gives access to all the bedrooms and the family bathroom which is well appointed with twin basins on a bespoke vanity unit with a marble top.- The principal bedroom with high ceiling has a stylish en suite bathroom with a separate shower and a dressing room fitted with bespoke wardrobes. There are 4 further bedrooms, two of which have en suite shower rooms, and one has access to a pretty balcony looking out to the rear garden.SituationThe property is situated within a popular residential area on southern side of Tunbridge Wells with the famous Pantiles and historic High Street, known for their restaurants, markets, special events and boutique shops, just over a mile away. The town is renowned for its educational facilities with schools for boys and girls of all ages in close proximity.Train Services: Tunbridge Wells station for services to London (Charing Cross, London Bridge and Cannon Street) in about an hour.OutsideTo the front of the house the gardens have been landscaped with areas of lawn and planting and a pathway leads to the beautiful oak front door whilst a resin-bonded driveway provides parking for a number of vehicles. To the rear, the landscaped gardens are predominantly laid to lawn with tall hedging providing a great deal of seclusion. Two terraces, one brick and one slate, provide ideal spots in which to sit, dine and entertain.
listing.short_description: A superb detached family house originally dating from the 1930’s and subsequently significantly extended and refurbished with exquisite attention to detail to provide substantial accommodation of over 3000 sq ft with a bright and spacious interior and a wonderful flexible layout.
listing.displayable_address: Whybourne Crest, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This detached former Victorian coach house has been imaginatively converted to an exceptionally high standard creating a spacious family house of over 3,000 sq ft including the garage. Throughout there are many outstanding features re-creating the original period character but at the same time incorporating design features for modern day living. Some of the notable features include the following:-• In the Entrance Hall there is a superb etched glass wall replicating the original period stable wall in the Kitchen/Dining Room.• The Drawing Room is an impressive, large well-proportioned room which has wide bi fold doors opening to the terrace and garden. There is polished wood flooring and glass double doors to the Kitchen/Dining Room. This room also has bi fold doors to the terrace and is beautifully fitted and equipped with long granite work surfaces and a long matching island unit with an extensive range of cupboards and drawers below. There is a range cooker with extractor hood above, tiled flooring with under floor heating and in the Dining Area a fireplace.• There are two further reception rooms which are ideal as either Sitting/Family Room or Study/TV Room etc.• On the first floor the delightful Principal Bedroom suite has two dressing rooms and a beautifully fitted bathroom with a roll top bath with ball and claw feet and separate shower cubicle. There is also access to an eaves storage area. There are three further bedrooms, two of which have attractive bay windows with plantation shutters and these bedrooms are all served by a well-fitted bathroom and a shower room.SituationBroadwater Down which is a wide, tree-lined avenue is one of the most highly regarded residential roads in Tunbridge Wells. It is in the favoured southern part of the town, convenient for access to the famous Pantiles about quarter of a mile away where there are restaurants, tea rooms, bars and boutiques. The High Street is about half a mile and a little further on the main line station. There are excellent shopping facilities in the town including major national stores at the Royal Victoria Shopping Mall and Calverley Precinct. Recreational amenities in the town include a cinema complex, two theatres, a sports and leisure centre, fitness gyms, golf courses and numerous restaurants etc. There are excellent education facilities for children of all ages including state, private and grammar schools.OutsideThe house is approached through a 5 bar gate to a wide parking and turning area leading to the garage, all well-screened by mature trees and shrubs. The main garden is on the south-west side and includes a wide terrace with original cobble stones and this leads to an area of lawn all flanked and well-screened by mature hedges and trees.Additional InformationTrain Services: Tunbridge Wells main line station for trains to Charing Cross, London Bridge and Cannon Street in about 50/55 minutes. Road communications: The A21 is to the north of Tunbridge Wells for a direct route to the M25 and the National motorway network.
listing.short_description: Situated along this popular tree-lined road less than a mile from the train station, this detached former Victorian coach house has been imaginatively converted to an exceptionally high standard creating a spacious family house with many outstanding features.
listing.displayable_address: Broadwater Down, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

listing.letting_fees:
The asking rent does not include the following letting fees which are inclusive of VAT

  • Contribution to tenancy agreement and references (per tenant) - £200
  • Extending the tenancy after the initial term expires - £50
  • Amendment of tenancy agreement to include a change of tenant to be agreed depending on balance of Term remaining (per tenancy)
  • Inventory Check-out (charge dependant on size of property) (per tenancy)
Check Out Kitchen, Bathroom, Reception Room ….Price from; £Plus 1 Room72Plus 2 Rooms85Plus 3 Rooms98Plus 4 Rooms120Plus 5 Rooms140Plus 6 Rooms150Plus 7 Rooms175Plus 8 Rooms190Plus 9 Rooms205If more than 9 additional rooms:205 plus £10 per extra room
listing.description: The Limes is a spacious and light detached individual house of character with a contemporary feel and an inspection is most strongly recommended.The accommodation is versatile with oak flooring throughout, with one of the four bedrooms being on the ground floor with en-suite shower room but with a further two to three reception rooms, dependent upon room arrangement. There are two parking spaces and a detached garage with wonderful gardens surrounding the house.The Limes is ideally located in the Camden Hill area close to Camden Park which provides superb access to Claremont school, Tunbridge Wells main line station, the High street and The Pantiles. A viewing is highly recommended.Tunbridge Wells has an excellent range of educational, leisure and shopping facilities including the Royal Victoria Place Shopping Centre. The main line station offers commuter services to the City and West End in under an hour by fast train.
listing.short_description: The Limes is a spacious and light detached individual house of character with a contemporary feel and an inspection is most strongly recommended.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This is a fine 1920's detached family house in a prime location less than a mile from the famous Pantiles and enjoying views across the town. The house has a spacious interior with original features such as oak panelling, matching doors and polished oak flooring, etc. Further points of particular note include:A delightful entrance/garden room which opens to the panelled reception hall creating an excellent first impression of this character house. The elegant well proportioned drawing room has outlooks on three sides with a wide bay window, a door to the garden and an open fireplace with Minster stone surround. The dining room is a good size room with arched glass fronted display cabinets to one end. The large kitchen/breakfast room is well fitted with an extensive range of cupboards and drawers under long granite work surfaces with a matching island unit, delightful original large dresser, walk in larder, butlers sink, hob and ovens etc. On the first floor there are five bedrooms all enjoying attractive outlooks plus a study. There is a large attic area with potential for further accommodation subject to planning approval. There is an integral garage which subject to the necessary consents could provide a further reception room if required. There is also a detached garage.SituationForest Road is a highly regarded location on the southern edge of Tunbridge Wells. The mainline station, the High Street and the famous Pantiles, are all within about 1 mile. In the town centre there are excellent shopping facilities, particularly at the Royal Victoria Place shopping precinct where there are many major national stores. There are highly regarded schools in the town including grammar schools and a wide variety of recreational amenities.Train Services: Tunbridge Wells station for trains to Charing Cross, London Bridge and Cannon Street about 50 minutes | Road Communications: The A21 is to the north of Tunbridge Wells for a direct route to the M25.OutsideThe gardens provide an attractive setting for the house with an excellent paved terrace on 2 sides facing south and west. This leads to a wide and long expanse of lawn interspersed by shrubs and flower beds with shrub borders . At the rear there is further lawn and all is well screened by mature trees and evergreens.Additional InformationA shower in the attic requires building regulation approval.
listing.short_description: Situated on the popular southern outskirts of Tunbridge Wells, less than a mile from the famous Pantiles, this fine detached family house offers spacious accommodation and enjoys far reaching views across the town.
listing.displayable_address: Forest Road, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

listing.description: Situated in a tucked away position with one other property on the favoured southern side of Tunbridge Wells, this prestigious and deceptively spacious family home was built by Millwood Homes in 2007 and offers superb accommodation. Having been updated and improved in many areas, points of particular note include:- A well equipped double aspect kitchen/breakfast room with a range of floor and wall mounted units, long black granite work surfaces, an adjacent fitted utility room and French doors opening directly to a superb area of decking with a vine covered pergola.- An elegant double aspect drawing room with two sets of French doors to the front, both with Juliet balconies, and a fine wood burning stove set within a stone fireplace.- A spacious dining room with French doors opening to the aforementioned decking and an excellent fitted study to the front of the house with a feature bay window.- On the first floor, the principal bedroom has two windows to the front with fantastic outlooks of the town, fitted wardrobes and a luxurious en suite shower room. The guest bedroom also has an en suite whilst the remaining three bedrooms are very well served by a superb family bathroom.SituationThe house is situated in a tucked away position off Forest Road in the highly regarded and sought after southern part of Tunbridge Wells. The famous Pantiles with its tea rooms, boutiques, restaurants and pubs and the picturesque High Street with further shops are both about a mile away with the train station a little further on. There are excellent schools in the town for boys and girls of all ages including primary, preparatory, independent and grammar schools.OutsideThe house is approached via a driveway shared with the neighbouring house and a private drive provides parking for several vehicles and access to the spacious integral garage. There is a paved path to the side of the house with a shed and the decked area adjoining the kitchen and the dining room provides an ideal spot in which to entertain. The garden is mainly laid to lawn with shrub borders, a pond and a central seating area with a further pergola.
listing.short_description: Situated in a tucked away position on the southern side of Tunbridge Wells, this deceptively spacious 5 bedroom family home was built by Millwood Homes in 2007 and has been updated in many areas since.
listing.displayable_address: Forest Road, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This property is offered for sale with no onward chain. Standing on a corner site in the much favoured and sought after Madeira Park in the southern part of the town, this detached character house was built by the renowned local builder Beale & Sons in 1927. With traditional brick and tile hung elevations with leaded light windows under a tiled roof this delightful family house now provides scope for updating and improvement. Some points of particular note include the following:-• The Entrance Hall has a polished wood floor and wide stairs rising to a half landing with tall windows to one side.• The Sitting Room and Dining Room both have polished wood floors, brick surround fireplaces and wide windows to the front with window seats. In the Sitting Room there are also French Doors to the garden.• The Kitchen/Breakfast Room has a fitted dresser with glazed cupboards with drawers and cupboards below, further storage cupboards in a tiled recess with space for a cooker, door to walk-in larder with window and door to outside.• On the first floor the spacious part galleried landing has polished wood flooring. The large principal bedroom has outlooks to front and rear, three of the bedrooms have fireplaces and two have wash hand basins. Adjoining the family bathroom is a separate WC.• The integral garage contains the gas fired boiler which we are informed by the Vendors is about 4 years old. The garage could possibly be converted to further living accommodation if required subject to necessary consents.SituationMadeira Park is a highly regarded residential road in the much favoured southern part of the town. Within walking distance of about ½ a mile are the railway station, the High Street, the famous Pantiles and a Sainsbury's superstore. In the town centre there are excellent shopping facilities including many national stores and a wide variety of individual shops and boutiques. There are excellent schools in the town including grammar schools, independent schools, primary schools and private preparatory schools. Recreational amenities include a cinema complex, theatres, golf courses, a sport centre and numerous restaurants.OutsideTo one side the drive leads to the integral garage which has double doors. The garden is well screened by mature hedges and is mainly laid to lawn and also includes a variety of trees and shrubs with a terrace by the house on the west side.
listing.short_description: Standing on a corner site in the much favoured and sought after Madeira Park in the southern part of the town this detached family house is offered with no onward chain.
listing.displayable_address: Madeira Park, Tunbridge Wells, Kent TN2

listing.agent_address: Clarence House, 6a High Street, Pembury, Tunbridge Wells
listing.description: Guide price £1M to £1.25M. Substantial detached Edwardian family home sitting in it's own grounds measuring approximately 2.3 acres. Located just outside the village of Pembury. With it's ample space this home would suit any family's needs with two large reception rooms and a further 20ft x 19ft family room which opens out to the garden, this could also be used for a ground floor bedroom as has its own shower room. Benefits include a large heritage style double garage and a decked terrace with a hot tub. The expansive lawn leads to the woodland area as well as a pond. EPC Grade ELocationLocated in the popular village of Pembury with its local shopping facilities including a primary school, doctors surgery, library, pharmacy, Tesco's supermarket and the new Tunbridge Wells hospital. The towns of Tunbridge Wells and Tonbridge are approximately three and five miles distant both offering mainline stations to London Charing Cross and Cannon Street. There is access onto the M25 via the A21.Our ViewThis stunning home enjoys privacy and space all around for a growing family. Benefits include a large heritage style double garage and a decked terrace with a hot tub. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./3

listing.description: A substantial detached family home located in a quiet cul-de-sac on the south side of Tunbridge Wells within easy reach of the town centre and The Pantiles. 5 Bedrooms including Master Suite with en-Suite and Dressing Room, Guest Bedroom with en-suite Shower, 3 Further Double Bedrooms, Family Bathroom, 3 Reception Rooms including Dining Room, Sitting Room, Study / Play Room, Kitchen / Breakfast Room, Utility Room, Cloakroom, Driveway Parking, Double Garage and Gardens. Viewing highly recommended.Kitchen / Breakfast Room - 18' 4'' x 12' 2'' (5.58m x 3.71m)Light and airy, well equipped with an extensive range of wall and base units, breakfast bar and space for a dishwasher. Fitted electric oven with separate grill above, electric hob, 1.5 bowl sink with mixer tap over and wood laminate flooring. There is ample room for a table and chairs making this a great family spaceUtility Room - 12' 2'' x 6' 6'' (3.71m x 1.98m)Gas boiler, fitted units with a 1.5 bowl sink unit, ample space for washing machine, tumble dryer, freezer and wine rack. Feature gas fireplace with marble panel and hearth. A large patio runs along the back of the property and then sweeps around one side of the lawn making a great area for outside entertaining
